nodes.value: Ir a dar un paseo, salir a caminar
to go for a walk
to take a stroll for leisure or exercise
Every evening, they go for a walk in the park.
Tiempo (meteorológico), clima
weather
atmospheric conditions (temperature, rain, etc.)
The weather forecast says it will be sunny tomorrow.
Mejorar
to get better
to improve in condition or quality
I hope your cold will get better soon.
Aprobar los exámenes
to pass exams
to succeed in academic tests or assessments
She studied very hard to pass her final exams.
Universidad
university
an institution for higher education and research
He plans to go to university to study engineering.
Estar allí para recibir/encontrar a alguien
to be there to meet someone
to wait for someone's arrival at a place
My parents will be there to meet me at the station.
Avión
plane
an aircraft with wings and one or more engines
Our plane is scheduled to depart at 3 PM.
Estoy seguro/a
I'm sure
expressing certainty or strong belief
I'm sure you'll enjoy the movie.
Hacer amigos
to make friends
to form new friendships with people
It's easy to make friends when you join a club.
Muchos/as, un montón de
lots of
a large number or amount of
She has lots of books in her library.
Curso (académico)
course (academic)
a series of lessons or studies
He enrolled in a Spanish language course.
Conseguir/comprar algo para alguien
to get someone something
to obtain or buy something for another person
Can you get me a glass of water, please?
Volver, regresar
to come back
to return to a place or person
He promised he would come back soon.
Entrar
to come in
to enter a place, such as a room or building
Please feel free to come in and have a seat.
Hacer ruido
to make noise
to create sounds, often loud or distracting
The construction workers are making a lot of noise.
Demasiado/a (cantidad)
too much
an excessive amount of something
There is too much salt in this soup.
Planificar, planear
to plan
to decide on and arrange in advance
We need to plan our trip carefully to save money.
Charla, discurso, presentación
talk (speech)
a speech or lecture on a particular subject
She gave an excellent talk about her research.
Cuidadosamente, con cuidado
carefully
with great attention, caution, or precision
Handle the antique vase carefully.
Estar bien, ir bien
to be fine
to be all right, satisfactory, or acceptable
Don't worry about me, I'll be fine.
Tarde (adjetivo - llegar tarde)
late
arriving after the expected or scheduled time
He apologized for being late to the meeting.
Novia
girlfriend
a person's regular female romantic partner
He bought flowers for his girlfriend.
Furioso/a, enfurecido/a
furious
extremely angry or enraged
She was furious when she discovered the mistake.
Decir/contar algo a alguien
to tell someone (something)
to communicate information or news to someone
Can you tell me what happened?
Taxi
taxi
a car with a driver for public hire
We called a taxi to take us to the airport.
Pronto, en breve
soon
in or after a short period of time
The movie will start soon, so let's find our seats.
Otro trabajo/empleo
another job
a different or additional employment position
He's looking for another job with better pay.
Ganar dinero (trabajando)
to earn money
to receive payment for work done
She works hard to earn money for her family.
Un poco más
a bit more
a slightly larger amount or quantity
Could you add a bit more sugar to my tea?
Dinero
money
a medium of exchange; currency
He saved enough money to buy a new car.
Hambriento/a, tener hambre
hungry
feeling a need or desire for food
After the long hike, I was very hungry.
Cambiar de opinión/idea
to change one's mind
to alter one's decision, opinion, or plan
I was going to the beach, but I changed my mind.
Hotel
hotel
an establishment providing accommodation and meals
We are staying at a nice hotel near the city center.
¿Qué harás?
What will you do?
asking about someone's future actions or plans
What will you do after you graduate?
Perder el trabajo/empleo
to lose one's job
to become unemployed, usually involuntarily
It's a difficult time if you lose your job.
Iremos a dar un paseo si el tiempo mejora
We'll go for a walk if the weather gets better
Si aprueba sus exámenes, irá a la universidad
If she passes her exams she'll go to university
Estaremos allí para recibirte en el aeropuerto cuando llegue el avión
We'll be there to meet you at the airport when the plane arrives
Estoy seguro de que hará muchos amigos nuevos cuando empiece su curso
I'm sure he'll make lots of new friends when he starts his course
Si te gusta la música, te conseguiré un CD
If you like the music, I'll get you a CD
Si estás muy ocupado ahora, volveré más tarde
If you're very busy now, I'll come back later
Nos oirán entrar si hacemos demasiado ruido
They'll hear us coming in if we make too much noise
Si planificas tu charla cuidadosamente, te irá bien
If you plan your talk carefully, you'll be fine
¡Si llego tarde otra vez, mi novia se pondrá furiosa!
If I am late again, my girlfriend will be furious!
Te llamaré si hay algún problema.
I will call you if there is a problem.
Cuando vea a Mary, le diré que estuviste aquí.
When I see Mary, I will tell her you were here.
Si el taxi no llega pronto, llegaremos tarde.
If the taxi doesn't come soon, we will be late.
Si consigo otro trabajo, ganaré un poco más de dinero.
If get another job, I will earn a bit more money.
Te compraré el almuerzo si tienes hambre.
I will buy you some lunch if you are hungry.
Cambiarán de opinión cuando vean el hotel.
They will change their minds when they see the hotel.
¿Qué harás si pierdes tu trabajo?
What will you do if you lose your job?
